designrequirements.title: Progressive enhancement
designrequirements.description: Major functionality like main navigation and search should work without JavaScript enabled.

documentation.title: Enable / Disable JavaScript in Chrome Developer Tools

designrequirements.title: Color contrast
designrequirements.description: Color contrast should at least pass WCAG AA (AAA for mobile).

designrequirements.title: H1
designrequirements.description: All pages have an H1 which is not the title of the website.

designrequirements.title: Headings
designrequirements.description: Headings should be used properly and in the right order (H1 to H6).

video.title: Why headings and landmarks are so important -- A11ycasts #18

designrequirements.title: Specific HTML5 input types are used
designrequirements.description: This is especially important for mobile devices that show customized keypads and widgets for different types.

designrequirements.title: Label
designrequirements.description: A label is associated with each input form element. In case a label can't be displayed, use aria-label instead.

designrequirements.title: Accessibility standards testing
designrequirements.description: Use the WAVE tool to test if your page respects the accessibility standards.

designrequirements.title: Keyboard navigation
designrequirements.description: Test your website using only your keyboard in a previsible order. All interactive elements are reachable and usable.

designrequirements.title: Screen-reader
designrequirements.description: All pages were tested in a screen-reader (VoiceOver, ChromeVox, NVDA or Lynx).

designrequirements.title: Focus style
designrequirements.description: If the focus is disabled, it is replaced by visible state in CSS.
